leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 神经科学-神经影像与连接组生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 预处理→配准→连接组→统计→评测
leaf_cluster.tool_form: pipelines + 图分析 + 可视化

tools.name: roodmri
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning benchmarking platform for out-of-distribution data in MRI
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking platform designed to evaluate the performance of deep learning models on out-of-distribution (OOD) MRI data, facilitating robust model assessment.

tools.name: ancp-bids
tools.one_line_profile: Python package to read, write, query, and validate BIDS datasets
tools.detailed_description: A library providing functionality to handle Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS) datasets, including reading, writing, querying, and validation capabilities.

tools.name: APPIAN
tools.one_line_profile: Automated pipeline for analyzing PET images in conjunction with MRI
tools.detailed_description: An open-source automated software pipeline designed to facilitate the analysis of PET tracer kinetic data in conjunction with MRI, aiming for reproducibility and ease of use.

tools.name: niCHART
tools.one_line_profile: Neuro-imaging brain aging chart for structural and functional MRI analysis
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive solution for analyzing standard structural and functional brain MRI data, implementing computational morphometry, signal analysis, quality control, and harmonization.

tools.name: conp-dataset
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad dataset for the Canadian Open Neuroscience Platform
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad dataset configuration for the Canadian Open Neuroscience Platform (CONP), facilitating access and management of neuroimaging data.

tools.name: UMM_ACR_QE
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab package for analysis of ACR quality control phantom MRI
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab package designed to analyze MRI scans of the ACR quality control phantom, automating the assessment of scanner performance metrics.

tools.name: MRIquality
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for routine MRI data quality assurance and control
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools for performing routine quality assurance and post-acquisition quality control on MRI data.

tools.name: abcd-dicom2bids
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for downloading and converting ABCD data to BIDS with QC
tools.detailed_description: A utility for selectively downloading QC-passed ABCD data, converting it to BIDS standard, and handling field map selection and metadata correction.

tools.name: fsqc
tools.one_line_profile: Quality control scripts for FreeSurfer and FastSurfer data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts to perform quality control on structural MRI data processed with FreeSurfer or FastSurfer.

tools.name: pyfMRIqc
tools.one_line_profile: Quality check calculator for functional MRI data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that calculates and provides metrics for the quality assessment of functional MRI (fMRI) data.

tools.name: HALFpipe
tools.one_line_profile: User-friendly pipeline for reproducible fMRI analysis
tools.detailed_description: ENIGMA HALFpipe is a software tool designed to facilitate reproducible analysis of fMRI data, emphasizing ease of use.

tools.name: raiders_data
tools.one_line_profile: fMRI dataset from naturalistic audio/video stimulation
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad-managed fMRI dataset containing responses to the movie 'Raiders of the Lost Ark', useful for benchmarking and analysis.

tools.name: micapipe
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal imaging and connectome analysis pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A processing pipeline for multimodal imaging and connectome analysis, integrating various neuroimaging tools.

tools.name: Qoala-T
tools.one_line_profile: Supervised-learning tool for QC of FreeSurfer segmented MRI data
tools.detailed_description: A supervised learning tool designed to automate the quality control of MRI data segmented using FreeSurfer.

tools.name: automatic-quality-control
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-supervised MRI quality control system
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a semi-supervised quality control system for MRI, trained using physics-based artefact generators and adversarial training.

tools.name: neurodocker
tools.one_line_profile: Generator for custom Docker and Singularity images in neuroscience
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool to generate custom Docker and Singularity images for neuroimaging and neuroscience, facilitating reproducible environments.

tools.name: reproserver
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for reproducing ReproZip packages in the cloud
tools.detailed_description: A web-based platform that allows users to upload and reproduce experiments packed with ReproZip in a cloud environment.

tools.name: reprozip
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for creating reproducible experiments from command-line executions
tools.detailed_description: A tool that simplifies the process of creating reproducible experiments by packing all necessary files and dependencies from command-line executions.

tools.name: VersionClimber
tools.one_line_profile: System for package evolution and version management in Data Science
tools.detailed_description: A system designed to handle package evolution and versioning issues specifically for Data Science workflows, aiding in reproducibility.

tools.name: BayesianQuickNAT
tools.one_line_profile: Bayesian QuickNAT for MRI segmentation and uncertainty-based QC
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of Bayesian QuickNAT for whole-brain MRI segmentation, providing structure-wise uncertainty estimates for quality control.

tools.name: quickNAT_pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of QuickNAT for MRI segmentation and QC
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch framework for fast brain MRI segmentation (QuickNAT and Bayesian QuickNAT) including segmentation quality control using uncertainty.

tools.name: SSSR_PET
tools.one_line_profile: Self-supervised super-resolution technique for PET images
tools.detailed_description: A self-supervised super-resolution (SSSR) deep learning model for PET imaging, using MRI guidance to improve image quality without paired training data.

tools.name: MRI-QA
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for MRI quality assessment
tools.detailed_description: A Convolutional Neural Network based model for automated quality assessment of 3D MRI volumes.

tools.name: niak
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for preprocessing fMRI and structural MRI scans
tools.detailed_description: A BIDS App pipeline for the preprocessing of functional and structural MRI data.

tools.name: bids-validator
tools.one_line_profile: Validator for the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS)
tools.detailed_description: A tool to validate if a dataset conforms to the Brain Imaging Data Structure (BIDS) specification.

tools.name: legacy-validator
tools.one_line_profile: Legacy validator for the Brain Imaging Data Structure
tools.detailed_description: The legacy version of the BIDS validator tool.

tools.name: PyNets
tools.one_line_profile: Reproducible workflow for connectome ensemble learning
tools.detailed_description: A reproducible workflow for structural and functional connectome ensemble learning, facilitating network analysis.

tools.name: dandisets
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad super-dataset of DANDI archive
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad super-dataset providing access to all Dandisets (neurophysiology data) from the DANDI archive.

tools.name: datalad
tools.one_line_profile: Data management tool for code, data, and containers
tools.detailed_description: A distributed data management tool that keeps code, data, and containers under control using git and git-annex, essential for reproducible science.

tools.name: datalad-catalog
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to create user-friendly data catalogs from metadata
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension to generate user-friendly, browser-based data catalogs from structured metadata.

tools.name: datalad-container
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad extension for containerized environments
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension that simplifies the management and execution of containerized computational environments (Docker, Singularity).

tools.name: datalad-crawler
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad extension for tracking web resources
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension for crawling and tracking web resources, converting them into datasets.

tools.name: datalad-dataverse
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad extension for Dataverse integration
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension that enables interoperability with Dataverse repositories for data publication and retrieval.

tools.name: DataLad Gooey
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical user interface for the DataLad data management tool
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface (GUI) for DataLad, designed to make decentralized data management and version control more accessible to researchers without command-line expertise. It supports standard DataLad operations for dataset creation, consumption, and modification.

tools.name: DataLad Metalad
tools.one_line_profile: Metadata handling extension for DataLad datasets
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension for handling metadata, allowing researchers to extract, aggregate, and report metadata from DataLad datasets. It supports various metadata standards and facilitates data discovery and management in neuroimaging and other scientific domains.

tools.name: DataLad Neuroimaging
tools.one_line_profile: Neuroimaging-specific extension for DataLad
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension that provides specialized functionality for neuroimaging research, including procedures for handling BIDS datasets and integrating with neuroimaging workflows.

tools.name: DataLad Next
tools.one_line_profile: Extension for experimental DataLad features
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension that houses new features, improvements, and experimental functionality before they are integrated into the core DataLad package. It serves as a staging ground for advanced data management capabilities.

tools.name: DataLad OSF
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad extension for Open Science Framework integration
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension that enables interaction with the Open Science Framework (OSF), allowing researchers to use OSF as a special remote for DataLad datasets, facilitating data sharing and collaboration.

tools.name: DataLad UKBiobank
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for managing UKBiobank data with DataLad
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension providing resources and procedures for working with UKBiobank data as DataLad datasets, streamlining the access and management of this large-scale biomedical database.

tools.name: fetal-IQA
tools.one_line_profile: Image quality assessment tool for fetal MRI
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for assessing the image quality of fetal MRI scans. It provides metrics and methods to evaluate the quality of fetal brain images, which is critical for downstream analysis.

tools.name: mriqception
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for aggregating and comparing MRIQC data
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed during Neurohackademy 2019 to aggregate public MRIQC data, allowing researchers to compare their MRI quality metrics against a larger population of datasets.

tools.name: Automatic Fetal Brain Quality Assessment Tool
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning tool for fetal brain MRI quality scoring
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based tool for automatic quality assessment of fetal brain MRI volumes. It uses a regression model to score each volume, aiding in the selection of high-quality data for analysis.

tools.name: CAUEEG-CEEDNet
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning algorithms for EEG-based MCI classification
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of deep learning algorithms and benchmarks for classifying mild cognitive impairment (MCI) using EEG data. It serves as a tool for early detection of dementia through electrophysiological signals.

tools.name: intensity-normalization
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for MR image intensity normalization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library containing various algorithms for normalizing the intensity of Magnetic Resonance (MR) images, which is a crucial preprocessing step for quantitative analysis and machine learning in neuroimaging.

tools.name: fMRI Quality Checker
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab/SPM12 scripts for fMRI quality metrics
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Matlab and SPM12 scripts designed to calculate various image and time-series quality metrics for fMRI data, facilitating quality control in fMRI studies.

tools.name: LangBrainScore
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for language models using neural and behavioral data
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking tool for evaluating Language Models (LMs) against human neural and behavioral experiment data. It allows researchers to score LMs based on their alignment with human brain processing of language.

tools.name: eddy_qc_release
tools.one_line_profile: Automated quality control for diffusion MRI
tools.detailed_description: Tools for automated quality control of diffusion MRI data, specifically designed to work with or complement FSL's eddy tool for correcting eddy currents and motion.

tools.name: datalad-getexec
tools.one_line_profile: DataLad extension for code execution during retrieval
tools.detailed_description: A DataLad extension that allows for code execution as part of the 'get' command, enabling dynamic data retrieval or generation workflows within the DataLad ecosystem.

tools.name: dcm_qa
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM to NIfTI/BIDS validation scripts
tools.detailed_description: A set of scripts and tools to validate the conversion of DICOM images to NIfTI format and BIDS structure. It helps ensure the integrity and correctness of neuroimaging data conversion.

tools.name: dcm_qa_asl
tools.one_line_profile: Validation scripts for ASL DICOM to NIfTI conversion
tools.detailed_description: Specialized validation scripts for Arterial Spin Labeling (ASL) MRI data, ensuring correct conversion from DICOM to NIfTI/BIDS formats.

tools.name: fMRIPrep
tools.one_line_profile: Robust preprocessing pipeline for fMRI data
tools.detailed_description: A robust and easy-to-use pipeline for preprocessing diverse fMRI data. It automatically adapts a best-in-breed workflow to the input dataset, ensuring transparency and reproducibility in fMRI analysis.

tools.name: MRIQC
tools.one_line_profile: Automated quality control for structural and functional MRI
tools.detailed_description: An automated quality control tool that extracts image quality metrics (IQMs) from structural (T1w, T2w) and functional MRI data. It generates visual reports to help researchers assess data quality.

tools.name: MRIQC-Learn
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning on MRIQC metrics
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing machine learning analysis on the image quality metrics (IQMs) generated by MRIQC, enabling automated classification or prediction of image quality.

tools.name: eCobidas
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to generate COBIDAS reporting checklists
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to help researchers adhere to the COBIDAS (Committee on Best Practice in Data Analysis and Sharing) guidelines by generating user-friendly checklists for reporting neuroimaging methods and results.

tools.name: fmriqa
tools.one_line_profile: Quality assurance scripts for fMRI data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Python scripts for performing quality assurance (QA) on fMRI data, providing metrics to evaluate data integrity and stability.

tools.name: VisualQC
tools.one_line_profile: Assistive tool for visual quality control of neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: A software tool designed to ease the manual quality control workflow of neuroimaging data by providing streamlined visualization interfaces for reviewing registration, segmentation, and other processing steps.

tools.name: spm12Batch
tools.one_line_profile: Batch processing ecosystem for SPM12 fMRI analysis
tools.detailed_description: A shell-based ecosystem for executing SPM12 fMRI preprocessing and analysis in a flexible, batch-oriented, and reproducible manner.

tools.name: RepoNeuroVis
tools.one_line_profile: Reproducible and programmatic neuroimaging visualizations
tools.detailed_description: A tool for creating reproducible and programmatic visualizations of human neuroimaging data, facilitating the generation of publication-quality figures.

tools.name: TemplateFlow Python Client
tools.one_line_profile: Python client for querying the TemplateFlow archive
tools.detailed_description: A Python client library to query and fetch neuroimaging templates from the TemplateFlow archive via pyBIDS, enabling standardized spatial normalization workflows.

tools.name: CoRR
tools.one_line_profile: The Cloud of Reproducible Records platform
tools.detailed_description: A platform developed by NIST to facilitate the sharing and reproducibility of scientific records and computations, supporting the verification of research results.

tools.name: Deep-QC
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning for MRI registration quality control
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based tool for automated quality control of MRI image registration, helping to identify failures in alignment processes.

tools.name: RadQy
tools.one_line_profile: Quality assurance tool for MRI and CT data
tools.detailed_description: A quality assurance and checking tool for quantitative assessment of Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) and Computed Tomography (CT) data, ensuring data suitability for analysis.

tools.name: IronSmithQSM
tools.one_line_profile: Automated pipeline for QSM processing and QC
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive, fully automated pipeline for creating and processing Quantitative Susceptibility Maps (QSM). It includes steps for extracting iron concentrations and evaluating data quality using SNR measures.

tools.name: BrainHub
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal Brain Understanding Benchmark
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite for multimodal brain understanding, providing tools and datasets to evaluate models on various brain-related tasks.

tools.name: TVC Benchmarker
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation tool for time-varying connectivity benchmarking
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool for benchmarking time-varying connectivity (TVC) methods in neuroimaging/fMRI. It allows researchers to generate synthetic data with known ground truth to evaluate connectivity estimation algorithms.
